page.title: 04HISTORY (contd)
page.content: was an area of green fields and scattered hamlets. There were farmhouses dotted here and there and people could walk along country lanes bordered by the sands and the sea. To the east, where Ty Mawr(Big House)Street is now, was a large house known as Danygraig House. This building, erected and occupied by Nathaniel Cameron, the 1st Mayor of Swansea, was placed in extensive grounds, and Ysgol St. is said to have been the drive which lead up to the house.Col. Cameron had his own company of volunteers and used to drill them on selected evenings on the Burrows. The population of the area steadily increased during the final years of the C19th and the early years of this. Industry was responsible for this.
